Diet and Nutrition
Increase Caloric Intake:
	•	Consume more calorie-dense foods like nuts, avocados, and healthy oils.
	•	Increase portion sizes during meals.
Choose Nutrient-Dense Foods:
	•	Prioritize protein-rich foods (lean meats, fish, eggs, legumes).
	•	Include complex carbohydrates (whole grains, sweet potatoes) for sustained energy.
	•	Consume plenty of fruits and vegetables for essential vitamins and minerals.

Diet and Nutrition
Maintain a Balanced Diet:
	•	Consume a variety of foods from all food groups in appropriate proportions.
	•	Choose lean protein options like chicken, turkey, fish, and tofu.
	•	Include a variety of carbohydrates, preferably whole grains, such as brown rice, quinoa, and whole wheat pasta.
	•	Ensure you get enough healthy fats from sources like avocados, nuts, and olive oil.

Diet and Nutrition
Control Portion Sizes:
	•	Reduce portion sizes to limit calorie intake.
	•	Opt for low-calorie, nutrient-dense foods like fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins.
	•	Limit the consumption of processed foods and those high in saturated fats and added sugars.
Increase Physical Activity:
	•	Incorporate regular exercise, such as walking, swimming, or playing sports.

Diet and Nutrition
Set Realistic Goals:
	•	Set achievable, short-term goals to improve your health.
	•	Take a gradual approach to making changes in your eating habits and lifestyle.
	•	Seek support from friends, family, or a healthcare professional to stay motivated.
Prioritize Food Quality:
	•	Choose whole and fresh foods over processed and calorie-dense options.
